name: Adonious WOOLARD, Petitioner v. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS, COUNTY OF PHILADELPHIA, et al.; Attorney General Office, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, et al.; Superior Court of Pennsylvania, et al., Respondents
name_abbreviation: Woolard v. Court of Common Pleas

parties: Adonious WOOLARD, Petitioner v. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS, COUNTY OF PHILADELPHIA, et al.; Attorney General Office, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, et al.; Superior Court of Pennsylvania, et al., Respondents.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 6th day of November, 2014, the Application for Leave to File Original Process and the Petition for Writ of Mandamus and/or Extraordinary Relief are DISMISSED. See Commonwealth v. Reid, 537 Pa. 167, 642 A.2d 453 (1994) (hybrid representation not permitted). The Prothonotary is DIRECTED to forward the filings to counsel of record.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
102 A.3d 1252
Adonious WOOLARD, Petitioner v. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS, COUNTY OF PHILADELPHIA, et al.; Attorney General Office, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, et al.; Superior Court of Pennsylvania, et al., Respondents.
No. 136 EM 2014.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Nov. 6, 2014.
